title: Kunde 2013 Kinneybrook Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: There's a mix of sweetness and greenness to this wine, a 100% varietal that is somewhat dull and unformed on the palate. It finishes slightly sour.

title: Tricky Rabbit 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)
description: There's nothing too tricky about this dilute, mealy smelling Sauvignon Blanc that's blended with 10% Carmenère for a reason we can't explain. With drawing white-grape tannins, this tastes green and citrusy, with a scallion note to the finish.

title: Arché 2012 Syrah (Texoma)
description: Craisin and geranium aromas mark the nose of this Texas Syrah. The medium-bodied palate brings more floral tones, soapy in nature, with soft tannins giving little support.

title: Chilcas 2013 Reserva Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: Blatant aromas of popcorn don't allow for much fruit expression on the nose. This is heavy and lacking in vitality. Flavors of toast, burnt wood, barrel resin and tropical fruits finish soft.

title: Convergence Zone 2014 Drizzle Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)
description: This wine still seems to be in its shell, showing considerable reduction that persists in the aromas and flavors. It drinks off dry with broad apple flavors.

title: Stony Lonesome 2013 Estate Reserve Barbera (Finger Lakes)
description: An unusual variety in New York, this Barbera contrasts a rich, deeply black berried nose against a palate that's chock full of sour cherries and dusty mineral tones. It's a bit out of balance, with a short, craggy finish.

title: Quintay 2014 Q Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: Red-berry aromas are damp, mulchy and not fully fresh. On the palate, this wine feels sticky, while flavors of briny, herbal red-berry fruits turn salty on the finish.

title: François Lurton 2013 Hacienda Araucano Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Earthy, leathery berry and mushroom aromas don't stir much interest. This feels tannic and heavy, while flavors of baked berry fruits and caramel finish hot and rugged.

title: One Hope 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This low-key, medium-bodied wine has subdued aromas and flavors, and a slight touch of herbs and lemon to lend personality. It's smooth in texture.

title: Estampa 2014 Estate White (Colchagua Valley)
description: Bland, pithy citrus aromas come with notes of saline solution and pool water. This is 85% Viognier and 15% Chardonnay, and the body is plump but vague. Flavors of papaya and pickle juice finish green, briny and melony.

title: Messina Hof NV G-S-M (Texas)
description: Dark grape-juice aromas carry through to the medium-bodied palate of racy black currant. Burnt sugar flavors mark the finish.

title: Heron 2013 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This good, generic red wine smells like mixed fruits and tastes mildly fruity along with light veggie flavors. It feels lean in texture and dry in balance.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2012  Bourgogne
description: This wine is soft, with a light fruitiness and earthy flavors typical of some Pinot Noir. The tannic element gives a dry core to this simple, fruity wine. Drink now.

title: McGregor 2014 Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)
description: Ruddy red cherry and plum notes are accented by woody bramble and spice tones in this rustic Pinot Noir rosé. It's dry in style with a stark, puckering finish.

title: Treleaven 2014 Wobbly Rock Rosé (Finger Lakes)
description: Despite ruddy, ripe raspberry and strawberry flavors, there's a leanness to this tart, savory dry rosé. Savory layers of bramble and herb are prominent on the midpalate.

title: Duchman Family NV Progression Red (Texas)
description: Fresh strawberries laced with geraniums and talcum powder mark the aromas of this Aglianico-Montepulciano blend. Tart red-currant and herbal bramble-berry flavors show bitter undertones, with gritty tannins giving support to the medium-bodied palate.

title: Foundry Vineyards 2014 White on White White (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is half Viognier with the balance a blend of Marsanne, Roussanne and Chardonnay. Aromas display a considerable amount of reduction that detracts from notes of peach and almond. It's dry and broad in feel, showing some bitterness on the finish.

title: Falernia 2014 Reserva Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley)
description: Aromas of orange and tangerine are oily on the nose. Melon, papaya and almond-skin flavors end with creamy lees notes that give way to bitterness on a dilute finish.

title: Eco Terreno 2014 Barrel Fermented Old Vine Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: There's a reduced quality to this wine and much ado about oak, in which it spent time (30% new French). Founder and winemaker Mark Lyon owns the 122-acre site where the Sauvignon Blanc blocks date back to 1973. A hit of jalapeño dominates on the finish.

title: Chono 2015 Single Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Leyda Valley)
description: This opens like an exploding hand grenade filled with pyrazines and jalapeño extract. The narrow, acidic palate is lacking in depth, but at least it's fresh. Briny, green flavors of jalapeño and bell peppers never let go, while the finish is tart and green, with a lasting note of bell pepper.

title: Mount Pleasant Winery 2008 Port (Augusta)
description: Made from Norton, this Port-style wine is dark and brooding, with cooked-down blackberries, tar and sanguine tones on the nose and palate. Thick, tannic and astringent, this might be best alongside an equally rich fillet with blue cheese crumbles.

title: Illinois Sparkling Co. NV Dollface Rosé Sparkling (Illinois)
description: Faint strawberry and raspberry on the nose turns to a shock of sour cherry on the palate. The acids are alive and kicking in this 100% Frontenac sparkling wine.

title: L.A. Cetto 2013 Chardonnay (Valle de Guadalupe)
description: Yeasty aromas are suggestive of vanilla wafer and corn cakes, with apple and melon scents lurking. A plump, low-acid palate delivers pithy, lightly bitter citrus and stone-fruit flavors, while notes of melon and honey fail to make much noise on the finish.

title: La Playa 2015 Estate Series Sauvignon Blanc (Curicó Valley)
description: Yellow in color and heavy on the nose, this smells mostly of match stick and sulfur. On the palate, this is scattered, with no point of reference. Heavy, chunky flavors of nectarine, citrus pith and almond skin finish oily and bitter.

title: St. Julian 2013 Braganini Reserve Traminette (Michigan)
description: A citrus-rind aroma takes on an earthy bee-pollen tone on the nose. A streamlined and citric palate shows a mild tropical fruit flavor, while racing towards an off-dry finish.

title: Weibel Family NV Almond Demi-Sec Sparkling (California)
description: A strong almond and marzipan aroma jumps out of the glass. Flavors are quite fruity and the almond note isn't as strong as in the aromas. This wine is softly sparkling and somewhat sweet.

title: Toulouse 2014 Valley Foothills Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: Sweet but thin fruit flavors follow floral, spicy aromas in this light-bodied wine. The texture is smooth and the finish short and lean.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2013 California Series Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Rather lean aromas and spare fruit flavors meet more lavishly rich flavors for dual personalities in this medium-bodied, soft-textured and slightly sweet wine.

title: Cucao 2015 Reserva Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: Mild, melony aromas are tropical in nature and show an oily note of lanolin. This feels heavy, while pithy flavors of melon are full of skin-based pyrazines. Green, bitter flavors taste more of grape skins than fruit.

title: 14 Hands 2014 Pinot Gris (Washington)
description: This wine starts out quite reductive which provides distraction. Aromas of flowers and ripe pear lead to broad flavors that seem to fall a bit flat.
